issue.title: dbforge add_column bug for postgres

repository.name: CodeIgniter
repository.description: Open Source PHP Framework (originally from EllisLab)

issue.body:
Found this error while trying to implement migration on a postgres database.

Issue: When trying to alter a table by adding a column, I would call the dbforge->add_column method and it then calls the _alter_table method in the database/drivers/postgre/postgre_forge.php file.

The call from dbforge->add_column

``` php
$sql = $this->_alter_table('ADD', $this->db->dbprefix.$table, $this->fields, $after_field); 
```

The method definition

``` php
function _alter_table($alter_type, $table, $column_name, $column_definition = '', $default_value = '', $null = '', $after_field = '') 
```

Problem: The definition is incorrectly overloaded. The logic might be incorrect also, but have not been verified.

body: Why the issue is closed? The bug still reproducable and it fires for all drivers except mysql

issue.title: Error applying IPv6 migration with PostgreSQL

repository.name: agendav
repository.description: A CalDAV web client similar to Google Calendar

issue.body:
On a fresh install (1.2.6.2), on Gentoo, with PostgreSQL, I'm launching `agendavcli dbupdate`, which give me this error: ```

A Database Error Occurred

Error Number:

ERROR: syntax error at or near "CHANGE" LINE 1: ALTER TABLE "sessions" CHANGE Array NOT NULL ^

ALTER TABLE "sessions" CHANGE Array NOT NULL

Filename: /usr/share/webapps/agendav/1.2.6.2/hostroot/agendav/application/migrations/004_ipv6.php

Line Number: 13

```

body:

```
